catalog_info.title: Environmental Economics and Policy Seminar
catalog_info.notes: Primarily for graduate students in economics or related fields with environmental interests. Offered jointly with the Kennedy School as API-905Y.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Graduate-level course in microeconomic theory.
catalog_info.description: Selected topics in environmental and resource economics. Emphasizes theoretical models, quantitative empirical analysis, and public policy applications. Includes invited outside speakers. Students must complete both parts of this course (parts A and B) within the same academic year in order to receive credit.
